summary: This document is the Articles of Incorporation and subsequent annual franchise tax reports for Laurel, Inc., a U.S. Virgin Islands corporation. It shows the company was incorporated on November 22, 2011, with initial incorporators from a law firm. By 2012, control shifted to Jeffrey Epstein, Darren Indyke, and Richard Kahn, who served as officers and directors. The company's stated purpose is 'Holding Property for Personal Use' and it filed annual reports through 2018.

persons.name: Erika A. Kellerhals
persons.context: One of the three persons forming the corporation Laurel, Inc. as listed in the original Articles of Incorporation filed in November 2011. She is associated with the law firm Kellerhals Ferguson LLP.

persons.name: Gregory J. Ferguson
persons.context: One of the three persons forming the corporation Laurel, Inc. as listed in the original Articles of Incorporation filed in November 2011. He is associated with the law firm Kellerhals Ferguson LLP.

persons.name: Brett Geary
persons.context: One of the three persons forming the corporation Laurel, Inc. in 2011. Later appears as a Notary Public in 2012, notarizing the consent of the new resident agent.

persons.name: Gina Marie Bryan
persons.context: Notary Public who acknowledged the signatures of the incorporators on the Articles of Incorporation in November 2011 and the Consent of Agent for Service of Process in October 2011.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Listed as President and Director of Laurel, Inc. in corporate filings from at least 2012 through 2018. Signed a Certificate of Change of Resident Agent in 2012.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Listed as Vice President, Secretary, and Director of Laurel, Inc. in corporate filings from at least 2012 through 2018. Signed a Certificate of Change of Resident Agent in 2012 as Secretary.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.context: Listed as Treasurer and Director of Laurel, Inc. in corporate filings from at least 2012 through 2018. Signed several of the annual franchise tax reports.

persons.name: Harry I. Beller
persons.context: Notary Public in New York who acknowledged the signatures of Jeffrey Epstein and Darren Indyke on the Certificate of Change of Resident Agent in 2012.

persons.name: Gregory R. Francis
persons.context: The Lieutenant Governor of the Virgin Islands who certified the filing of the Articles of Incorporation for Laurel, Inc. on December 27, 2011.

connections.description: Served together as President and Secretary, respectively, of Laurel, Inc., and both signed corporate documents.
Served together as President and Treasurer, respectively, of Laurel, Inc., as per multiple annual reports.
Served together as officers and directors of Laurel, Inc.
Partners in the law firm Kellerhals Ferguson LLP, which served as the initial resident agent for Laurel, Inc.
Kellerhals was an initial incorporator of the company that later came under Epstein's control. Her firm was the original registered agent.

events.title: Incorporation of Laurel, Inc.
events.description: Articles of Incorporation for Laurel, Inc. are filed in the U.S. Virgin Islands by Erika Kellerhals, Gregory Ferguson, and Brett Geary.

events.title: Certification of Incorporation
events.description: The Lieutenant Governor of the Virgin Islands certifies the filing of the Articles of Incorporation for Laurel, Inc.

events.title: Change of Corporate Control and Agent
events.description: A Certificate of Change shows Jeffrey Epstein and Darren Indyke as President and Secretary, replacing the original incorporators. The resident agent is changed from Kellerhals Ferguson LLP to Business Basics VI, LLC.

events.title: Annual Franchise Tax Filings
events.description: Laurel, Inc. files annual franchise tax reports and balance sheets with the Virgin Islands government each year from 2012 through 2018, signed by Epstein, Indyke, and Kahn.

keyFacts: Laurel, Inc. was incorporated in the U.S. Virgin Islands on November 22, 2011, with the stated business purpose of 'Holding Property for Personal Use.'

By 2012, control of the corporation had shifted to Jeffrey Epstein (President/Director), Darren Indyke (Vice President/Secretary/Director), and Richard Kahn (Treasurer/Director), who remained in these roles through at least 2018.
The company's financial statements show minimal paid-in capital ($1,000) but increasing cash balances and 'advances' (liabilities) over time, reaching over $37,000 in cash by the end of 2017.
The corporation consistently reported net losses from operations in its annual statements of income, resulting in an accumulated deficit.
The document trail shows the establishment and maintenance of a Virgin Islands corporate entity controlled by Jeffrey Epstein and his close associates.
